Sensor Readout Correction
(for Medium CameraLink)

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

Most camera sensors are read out sequentially in the so called raster scan format (line by line from top-left to bottom-right) However, to speed up the data transfer, some sensors can be configured to read out several pixels in parallel. As a result, pixels transferred succeeding over the CamerLink cable are not necessarily neighbouring pixels. The Sensor Readout Correction can reshuffle the pixels on-board of the frame grabber and transfer the grabbed image in the usual raster-scan fashion. All common readout strategies are supported to save computational power of the host system.


Parameters
.

Readout Mode

The parameter Readout Mode selects the pixel reshuffeling scheme:

Sensor Mode Function Mode No.
SMODE_UNCHANGED
->
 0
SMODE_REVERSE
<-
 3
SMODE_TAB4_0
1>     2>    
3>     4>
 2
SMODE_TAB4_1
<4     <3    
<2     <1
 5
SMODE_TAB4_2
12>
<34
 7




IHere you can see the SMODE_UNCHANGED mode for quad tap. Read out direction is forward. The pixel readout procedure is devided by four taps.

Here you can see the SMODE_REVERSE mode for quad tap. Readout direction is backward. The pixel readout procedure is devided by four taps.

The SMODE_TAB4_0 which is mode no. 2 reads out fourth the line in parallel and forward for quad tap cameras.

The SMODE_TAB4_1 which is mode no. 5 reads out fourth the line in parallel and backward for quad tap cameras.

The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB4_2 (mode 7) reads out half the line forward and half the line backward, but the number of pixels of one half are diveded by two taps.
.
